body.description: Product Description A great, refreshing clean every time Make changing time clean time with Pampers Baby Fresh wipes with Softgrip Texture. Baby Fresh wipes are 4X stronger than the leading U.S. subbrand. They are hypoallergenic and have a refreshing scent. Plus, Baby Fresh wipes have lotion with pure water in every wipe. During changing time, your baby will love the refreshing clean of Pampers Baby Fresh wipes. Brand Story By Pampers

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Thick and Gentle As mild and gentle as using a washcloth and water, Sensitive wipes are ideal for the most sensitive baby skin. pH Balancing Made with simple, gentle ingredients, Sensitive wipes contain a touch of pH balancing lotion to help keep your baby’s skin healthy by maintaining skin’s natural pH One-Wipe Pop-Top Nothing is more frustrating than reaching for a wipe and getting three or four. That’s why our one-wipe pop-top is designed to help ensure you only get what you want. Pair with Swaddlers Diapers To help keep your baby’s skin dry and healthy, we recommend pairing Sensitive wipes with Pampers Swaddlers—our softest diapers made with our BreatheFree Liner that pulls wetness away from skin

Compare Our Wipes 0% alcohol/parabens derma-tested 1-wipe pop-top fragrance free for sensitive skin 0% alcohol/parabens derma-tested 1-wipe pop-top fragrance free for sensitive skin 0% alcohol/parabens derma-tested 1-wipe pop-top fragrance free for sensitive skin 0% alcohol/parabens derma-tested 1-wipe pop-top fragrance free for sensitive skin

Our Commitment Caring for babies is in our DNA. Our Pampers Bright Beginnings programs enable healthy development and early success for babies and families through education, hospital partnerships, and donations March of Dimes Partnership Pampers is proud to support the March of Dimes in giving every baby a fighting chance. We help provide our smallest diapers to the 1 million babies born before 28-week gestational age each year Sustainability Pampers cares for every baby and the planet they grow up in. We maintain zero manufacturing to landfill across all our plants and are committed to 100% renewable electricity by 2030 Community Donations Through ongoing donation efforts and partnerships with organizations like Feeding America and Matthew 25, Pampers strives to help babies get the bright beginnings they deserve Changing Table Access 9 out of 10 dads have used a public restroom that lacks a changing table. As part of our “Love the Change” campaign, we’re providing 5,000 changing tables for men’s restrooms across North America Hospital Support Proud to be the #1 choice of U.S. hospitals for nearly 50 years, we partner with nurses to develop skin-protecting products and support nursing education—all to help baby’s healthy development

Are Pampers wipes safe for my newborn baby? Yes! Babies' health and safety are our first priority at Pampers with our hypoallergenic products that are free of parabens and latex. Our wipes are safe and are clinically proven for sensitive skin. Dermatologist approved Are these wipes flushable? No. Our baby wipes are thick and gentle and are not designed to be flushed Which diaper should I use with Pampers Sensitive baby wipes? We recommend using Pampers Swaddlers diapers with Pampers Sensitive wipes together for healthy skin. Pampers Swaddlers diapers are softer and made with our BreatheFree Liner that provides breathability and pulls wetness away from the skin How does pH affect my baby's skin? Urine and bowel movements have pH levels that vary from baby's skin and are further affected by diet and health. When higher or lower pH levels contact skin, they can cause irritation. To help prevent irritation, pH must be balanced or neutralized Do Pampers wipes come with a pop-top? Yes! Pampers Sensitive wipes are available with either a pop-top or refill pack which can be used in wipes containers. Our pop-tops come with a one-wipe dispensing lid so you only get the wipes you need

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product, Great Price
reviews.reviewText: My youngest baby (and I have four kids, so I have gone through literally tens of thousands of baby wipes) has sensitive skin, and we had previously had an issue with a generic brand of scented wipes, so we had to switch to unscented.Well, these wipes are actually a better deal than the generics we were buying. I meant to buy unscented Pampers wipes but spaced out and bought the scented kind. My husband reminded me that I was supposed to buy unscented when I went online to track the order, and the package was almost to our house. So I was a little nervous about using these, but so far we have not had any problems. My baby is happy and rash-free, and the wipes smell great. Pampers has a different smell than other wipes, but it's a good different. It's more of a fresh, clean, maybe a hint of citrus, smell as opposed to the "old lady perfume" smell of scented wipe competitors. More importantly, these wipes are good at their main job, which is to wipe the baby with. I have never had to use more than two for a single diaper change, and my baby isn't old enough to generate solid waste yet if you get my drift.I cannot reiterate how good of a deal this is. I will never buy wipes at the store again as long as they stay at this price on Amazon. Even the cases of generic wipes at the store are about the same price or more than these, and Pampers wipes are higher-quality than any other brand I know of.The only downside is that these are the refill packs and are not resealable, so you have to have a container to put them in. But I had a few wipe containers laying around the house, so this was not a problem at all for us. Just putting that out there, though, in case anyone thought they were the resealable packs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Deal & Nice Quality
reviews.reviewText: I like these wipes because they smell nice, are thick enough (without being stiff) and are wet enough to clean the poo off easily. These packages come wrapped in plastic without a flip top lid like the Huggies but I simply cut a slit in the top and throw the whole thing in my Prince Lionheart Warmies wipes warmer. Wala! I tried doing the whole reusable wipes thing and it was a poopy hassle and mildewy nightmare. I didn't feel good about throwy poopy wipes in the wash with baby's clothing and it seemed ridiculous to do a load of wash just for a bunch of wipes. When mildew started creeping in despite my anti-mildew home remedy efforts like adding vinegar to the solution, it was game over. Disposables are so much easier, more hygienic and cheaper at this price. My son has sensitive skin in the form of small dry patches on his arms and legs and irritation if I don't clean spit-up off super well but I've never had any problems with these. I keep a 4x6"ish piece of thin cardboard by the changing table to fan baby's bottom for daytime changes to dissipate moisture and air out the booty periodically. He loves the breezy sensation and gives big smiles. It's hilarious.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These wipes are amazing! I've never tried pampers wipes before and they ...
reviews.reviewText: These wipes are amazing! I've never tried pampers wipes before and they are nice and soft without being "weak". They smell great too! I was able to get these for a lot cheaper than I've gotten any other wipes from the store before. I got 3 items at a subscription, these wipes, a big box of huggies and a box of huggies overnights for the same price that I used to be able to get a big box of diapers at the local store down here, so I'm extremely happy with the price of the items! I highly recommend this to any parents, especially new parents that haven't thought about doing it this way before!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pampers wipes surpass the competition.
reviews.reviewText: Pampers is by far the best brand in wipes. Pampers lasts longer because the wipes are thicker. It only takes one to two wipes maximum to get a poopy diaper cleaned up. The ridges on the wipe are fabulous at cleaning the extra pieces so that I don't have to do any "scrubbing" I also am able to feel secure in that I am able to provide my baby with a gentle wipe that won't irritate her. It is definitely worth the extra price to have a better quality wipe.Think about it..... It takes 1 wipe with pampers to do what 3-6 wipes of other brands can do.Overall: the non irritating, gentle, high quality wipes are well worth the price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My wife SCREAMED at me
reviews.reviewText: "JIMMY!!!"The sudden screeching of my name came from upstairs...In the baby's room.I trip over myself as I'm sprinting upstairs -- I can't get to the baby fast enough.Then, the wretched stink of liquid rotting apple strawberry banana...Freshly digested, and smeared over everything.My wife is staring at me in disbelief.My baby? Giggling, and smiling at me from ear to ear...Inside his sh** smeared crib, with a brown-yellow striped exploded up his back.Immediately, I grabbed a garbage bag, and a pack of these wipes.My wife turned on the shower, and we went to work -- she would hose down the giggling baby, who's obvious well aware of the crap he caused...And I would wipe down the everything.Scrape by scrape, each wad of sludge would find its way to the bottom of the bag.Once the mess was over, a gentle scrubbing with bleach and fire would ensure a sterile environment.Could I have used paper towels? Sure -- but they weren't handy when I needed them.Could I have sold the house instead? If this happens again, that IS an option.But if you have a baby who poops, then these wipes will handle anything.
